wikipedia_page.main: John Hawksford (5 October 1806—3 September 1887) was a successful and wealthy solicitor and attorney, a prominent member of the Roman Catholic laity of Wolverhampton and served as Mayor of Wolverhampton from 1863/64, becoming the first Roman Catholic to do so.

response: |align=center| 15 || John Hawksford || 1863/64 ||align=center| 1 || Attorney & solicitor, First Catholic Mayor of Wolverhampton
*John Hawksford (1806–1887), solicitor, benefactor, served as 15th Mayor of Wolverhampton 1863/64 and became the first Roman Catholic to do so.
